snippet.textDisplay:
ESPN should take an example from their own studio...

Jalen Rose predicted that *gasp* last year's Warriors, having added Boogie Cousins to that roster with Curry, Thompson, Green, and Durant, might *gasp* not win the title! That another team might gasp pull off an upset!

He got laughed at hard by all the other panelists for suggesting such a thing!

What then happened?

The Warriors not only failed to win the title, but they had their worst record in Steve Kerr's tenure! Yes, they still made the finals, but anyone and everyone acting like they'd already won the title and should be crowned before the season began (or mid-season) looked ridiculous! That prediction could not have been further off!

Never celebrate too early. Never predict it's over until it's mathematically over. Upsets happen all the time in sports. Comebacks happen all the time. "The impossible" happens all the time!

The worst thing you can possibly do is celebrate too early! ESPN, of all entities, should know that!
snippet.textOriginal:
ESPN should take an example from their own studio...

Jalen Rose predicted that **gasp** last year's Warriors, having added Boogie Cousins to that roster with Curry, Thompson, Green, and Durant, might **gasp** *not* win the title! That another team might *gasp* pull off an upset!

He got laughed at hard by all the other panelists for suggesting such a thing!

What then happened?

The Warriors not only failed to win the title, but they had their worst record in Steve Kerr's tenure! Yes, they still made the finals, but anyone and everyone acting like they'd already won the title and should be crowned before the season began (or mid-season) looked ridiculous! That prediction could not have been further off!

Never celebrate too early. Never predict it's over until it's mathematically over. Upsets happen all the time in sports. Comebacks happen all the time. "The impossible" happens all the time!

The worst thing you can possibly do is celebrate too early! ESPN, of all entities, should know that!

snippet.textDisplay:
Gab is 100%. I can only think that Dan is trying to fabricate banter for the sake of clicks/tweets/ratings. Until it's over, it's not over. Incredible comebacks/collapses happen in sports.

Ask the '78 Red Sox. Ask the '69 Cubs. Ask the '64 Phillies. Ask Jean van de Velde. Ask Greg Norman. Ask the '04 Yankees. Ask the '51 Brooklyn Dodgers. Ask the '92 Houston Oilers. Go ask '17 PSG. Go ask '05 AC Milan.

Massive collapses happen. Declaring something "over" before it's actually over is stupid. I guess this is why almost nobody takes ESPN seriously anymore. The sane guy on this panel (Gab) who is doing nothing but talking rationally and with common sense is derided and opposed by the host.

Guess I'll now go another year or two before I click on any other ESPN videos.
snippet.textOriginal:
Gab is 100%. I can only think that Dan is trying to fabricate banter for the sake of clicks/tweets/ratings. Until it's over, it's not over. Incredible comebacks/collapses happen in sports.

Ask the '78 Red Sox. Ask the '69 Cubs. Ask the '64 Phillies. Ask Jean van de Velde. Ask Greg Norman. Ask the '04 Yankees. Ask the '51 Brooklyn Dodgers. Ask the '92 Houston Oilers. Go ask '17 PSG. Go ask '05 AC Milan.

Massive collapses happen. Declaring something "over" before it's actually over is stupid. I guess this is why almost nobody takes ESPN seriously anymore. The sane guy on this panel (Gab) who is doing nothing but talking rationally and with common sense is derided and opposed by the host.

Guess I'll now go another year or two before I click on any other ESPN videos.

snippet.textDisplay: Liverpool don’t have any flaws unlike Man City. It’s over it don’t care if you say “it’s not mathematically” they are 13points and 1 game behind so maybe 16poinds ahead of Leicester. Liverpool played like city has never played yesterday.
snippet.textOriginal: Liverpool don’t have any flaws unlike Man City. It’s over it don’t care if you say “it’s not mathematically” they are 13points and 1 game behind so maybe 16poinds ahead of Leicester. Liverpool played like city has never played yesterday.

snippet.textDisplay:
Gab is not only right, but history tells us one major thing...

Oftentimes, when you start celebrating before the result is decided, bad things happen to the team that starts celebrating too early!

Mathematically, it's still possible for Liverpool to give up their lead. There's a very real possibility that Man City wins the rest of their games, and Liverpool, having heard everyone predicting they've already won, celebrates too early, loses not only to Man City, but 3 other teams, draws one more (but still win 15 of their final 20 matches), and suddenly, they end level on points with Man City and lose the title once again!

Just because they were incredible in the first half of the season doesn't necessarily mean it'll happen in the second half. Heck, if they win 15 and draw 1 in their last 20 matches, that's 46 points (2.3 points per match) and that would still be incredible and leave them with 98 points. But again, it's still mathematically possible for City to reach 98. Until the math says one team has won, that team has not won. And one of the easiest ways to ensure you don't end up winning is to celebrate too early.

I still think my team (Liverpool) will win! Although, even I'm getting worried hearing all the pundits talk about them as if they've already won! I've seen what happens when that happens.

No one thought Alex Ferguson's Man U could possibly give up an 8 point lead with 6 matches remaining in 2012. They did! No one thought that Man City still had a title shot down 2-1 when the 90th minute passed in the final game of that year. Man City incredibly scored 2 goals in stoppage time to win the title! No one though Leicester could possibly win the title. They did!

Until it is mathematically impossible to lose, you have not yet won! Everyone should use that as a life lesson, and I'm badly hoping Liverpool know that as well!

snippet.textDisplay:
The race is not over in the minds of players at Liverpool and that’s all that matters. They need to believe that it’s not over so they can go out with the determination required to win. They need that push, that extra motivation and it’ll make it all the more sweeter when we win.

From a fan’s point of view: yeah, it’s over. 13 points clear with a game in hand at Christmas is insane. Liverpool played 18, won 17 and drew 1. That’s insane to even think about.
snippet.textOriginal:
The race is not over in the minds of players at Liverpool and that’s all that matters. They need to believe that it’s not over so they can go out with the determination required to win. They need that push, that extra motivation and it’ll make it all the more sweeter when we win. 

From a fan’s point of view: yeah, it’s over. 13 points clear with a game in hand at Christmas is insane. Liverpool played 18, won 17 and drew 1. That’s insane to even think about.

snippet.textDisplay:
Liverpool has the opportunity to set 2 record.
1. One is being the 1st team to win the league unbeaten with more then 100 points.
2. On the other hand, Liverpool can set the unenviable record of losing the premiership after leading by 15 points at the turn of the New year.

snippet.authorDisplayName: Henk Williem Adriannus van der Napier
snippet.textDisplay: It not over yet, guys. There had been only three occasions where the team that was leading the table at Christmas failed to win the league title, and in all three occasions, it was Liverpool. It ain't over until it is over. Let's take one game at a time. As Vilkas said, "Eyes on the enemies, not on the horizon". An Elder  Scroll quote for you there.
snippet.textOriginal: It not over yet, guys. There had been only three occasions where the team that was leading the table at Christmas failed to win the league title, and in all three occasions, it was Liverpool. It ain't over until it is over. Let's take one game at a time. As Vilkas said, "Eyes on the enemies, not on the horizon". An Elder  Scroll quote for you there.

snippet.textDisplay:
PSG 4-0 Marseille. PSG 7 points ahead, with a game in hand, of 2nd place Marseille.
Leicester 0-4 Liverpool. Liverpool 13 points ahead, with a game in hand, of 2nd place Leicester.

Is there a more uncompetitive league in Europe at the moment than the English league?

snippet.textDisplay: Stupid, idiotic, moronic pundits.  Stop saying it's 'over.'  It's just so ignorant and blinkered.  There is half a season to go - anything can happen - a couple of bad results can change things.  It's likely that Liverpool will win but it's far from over.

snippet.textDisplay: Leicester this season looks like Liverpool of 13/14 when BR was in-charged. No European commitment and able to give their all almost every week. But EPL football has moved on (yet again) from then and the best BR can do is focus on Top 4 this season, see how the team performs with European commitment. Liverpool fans know too well what happened after that magical season.
snippet.textOriginal: Leicester this season looks like Liverpool of 13/14 when BR was in-charged. No European commitment and able to give their all almost every week. Liverpool fans know too well what happened after that magical season.
